feed.title: A Qt Blog
feed.subtitle: The blog where it's OK to feed the Trolls

entry.title: KBarcode 2.0.0 released
entry.summary: From KDE Apps: Version 2.0.0 of KBarcode, a KDE application for barcode and label printing, has been released. New features include printing from data sources including SQL queries, CSV files and the KDE address book, JavaScript support, new barcode formats,...
entry.content:
From KDE Apps:

Version 2.0.0 of KBarcode, a KDE application for barcode and label printing, has been released. New features include printing from data sources including SQL queries, CSV files and the KDE address book, JavaScript support, new barcode formats, batch printing configured through a wizard, and a rewritten PDF manual. Downloads (source, SUSE 10 and FC3 RPM) here, screenshots here. Requires KDE 3.3.

entry.title: Akademy 2006 will be in Dublin
entry.summary: From KDE Apps: The annual KDE world summit, Akademy, will be held at Trinity College in Dublin, Republic of Ireland, from 23rd to 30th September. The event will consist of a contributors' conference, the KDE e.V. AGM, and a five-day...
entry.content:
From KDE Apps:

The annual KDE world summit, Akademy, will be held at Trinity College in Dublin, Republic of Ireland, from 23rd to 30th September. The event will consist of a contributors' conference, the KDE e.V. AGM, and a five-day hacking session with workshops (26th-30th). The conference will be organised by Marcus Furlong who has organised a GUADEC in Dublin in the past and "contributes to KDE by taking a sh*tload of work on him".
